title: A Bipartisan Pivot in Biden’s Second Year
sub_head: Congressional Democrats should give up delusions of political revolution.
body:
What a difference a year makes.
On Jan. 21, 2021, the day after President Biden was inaugurated, newly elected Rep. Ritchie Torres (D., N.Y.) was exuberant. With a Democratic House, Senate and president, he said, “we have the makings of an FDR moment.”
